# CXCallObserver

**Class**

A programmatic interface for an object that manages a list of active calls and observes call changes.

## Declaration

```swift
class CXCallObserver
```

## Overview

You can retrieve a list of active calls on an [doc://com.apple.callkit/documentation/CallKit/CXCallObserver] object using the [doc://com.apple.callkit/documentation/CallKit/CXCallObserver/calls] property. You can also provide an object conforming to the [doc://com.apple.callkit/documentation/CallKit/CXCallObserverDelegate] protocol as the call observer delegate using the [doc://com.apple.callkit/documentation/CallKit/CXCallObserver/setDelegate(_:queue:)] method to respond to any active call changes.

VoIP apps typically interact with the [doc://com.apple.callkit/documentation/CallKit/CXCallObserver] object returned by the [doc://com.apple.callkit/documentation/CallKit/CXCallController/callObserver] property of a [doc://com.apple.callkit/documentation/CallKit/CXCallController] instance. However, any app can create a new [doc://com.apple.callkit/documentation/CallKit/CXCallObserver] object to be notified of any calls activity on the system.

## Setting a Delegate

- **setDelegate(_:queue:)**: Sets a call observer delegate, specifying an optional queue on which to execute delegate methods.

## Accessing Calls

- **calls**: Returns the active calls of the telephony provider.

## Call information

- **CXCall**: A telephony call.
- **CXCallObserverDelegate**: A collection of methods the system calls when a call changes state.
- **CXHandle**: A way to reach a call recipient, such as a phone number or email address.

## Inherits From

- NSObject

## Conforms To

- CVarArg
- CustomDebugStringConvertible
- CustomStringConvertible
- Equatable
- Hashable
- NSObjectProtocol
